Abstract
Using A Visual drag and drop tool called Orange

1 Introduction to Orange

Orange is a visual drag-and-drop tool for

  • Data visualization
  • Machine Learning
  • Data mining

and much more. Here is what it looks like:

All operations are done using a visual menu-driven interface. The visuals can be exported to PNG/SVG/PDF and the entire workflow can be exported into a Report Form and edited for presentation and sharing.

2 Installing Orange

You can download and install Orange from here:

https://orangedatamining.com/download/

3 Basic Usage of Orange


4 Orange Workflows


5 Widgets and Channels


6 Loading data into Orange


We are good to get started with Orange!!

7 Simple Visuals using Orange

Let us create some simple visualizations using Orange.

  • Use the File Widget to import the iris dataset into your session
  • Use the Data Table Widget to look at the data, and note its variable names
  • Use the Visualization Widgets ( Scatter Plot, Bar Plot, and Distributions) to look at the properties of the variables, and examine relationships between them.

8 Reference

  1. Introduction to Data Mining-Working notes for the hands-on course with Orange Data Mining.(Download file)

  2. Orange Data Mining Widget Catalog: Look here for help and guidance! https://orangedatamining.com/widget-catalog/

## Introduction to Orange

**Orange** is a visual drag-and-drop tool for

-   Data visualization
-   Machine Learning
-   Data mining

and much more. Here is what it looks like:

![](https://orangedatamining.com/screenshots/images/tree-explorative.thumb.png)

All operations are done using a visual menu-driven interface. The
visuals can be exported to PNG/SVG/PDF and the entire workflow can be
exported into a Report Form and edited for presentation and sharing.

## Installing Orange

You can download and install Orange from here:

<https://orangedatamining.com/download/>

## Basic Usage of Orange

## Loading data into Orange

{{< youtube MHcGdQeYCMg >}}

<br>

We are good to get started with Orange!!

## Simple Visuals using Orange

Let us create some simple visualizations using Orange.

-   Use the File Widget to import the `iris` dataset into your session
-   Use the Data Table Widget to look at the data, and note its variable
    names
-   Use the Visualization Widgets ( Scatter Plot, Bar Plot, and
    Distributions) to look at the properties of the variables, and
    examine relationships between them.

## Reference

1.  Introduction to *Data Mining-Working notes for the hands-on course
    with Orange Data Mining*.[(Download
    file)](Interactive%20Visual%20Data%20Mining%20in%20Orange%20-%20kolkata.pdf)

2.  Orange Data Mining Widget Catalog: Look here for help and guidance!
    <https://orangedatamining.com/widget-catalog/>
